my email

Subject: A teenager was brutally beaten by the police officers in Hong Kong

Dear sir

I'm writing to express my deep concern over the brutal beating of a teenage girl by the Hong Kong Police recently in Hong Kong.

The beating took place on 12/6 during the demonstration against the Extradition Bill proposed by the HK Government. Tens of thousands of students and citizens took to the street and voiced their concerns over the terrible consequences of the bill.

During the demonstration, an unarmed girl fell prey to a dozen police officers armed with baton. As you can see in the brief footage (https://i.lihkg.com/540/https://na.cx/i/aQu85Ja.gif) (credit to Apple Daily, a local newspaper), the girl was already on the ground, with her hands over her head, while the batons rained down on her. If you watch closely, you can see two of them using the shield as a weapon to launch their attack (one was aimed at her head). It was clear that the girl was already under submission and the use of batons and the beating was totally unnecessary, unacceptable and horrifying to watch.

The whereabouts of the girl is still unknown.

As a Hong Kong citizen, it is heartbreaking to have seen this beating and I can't simply get the footage out of my head. Every time I feel sick just thinking of it.

I understand your organization has great impact and can spread the message to the world. Please, the world needs to see this.

Thank you.

my email

Subject: A teenager was brutally beaten by the police officers in Hong Kong

Dear sir

I'm writing to express my deep concern over the brutal beating of a teenage girl by the Hong Kong Police recently in Hong Kong.

The beating took place on 12/6 during the demonstration against the Extradition Bill proposed by the HK Government. Tens of thousands of students and citizens took to the street and voiced their concerns over the terrible consequences of the bill.

During the demonstration, an unarmed girl fell prey to a dozen police officers armed with baton. As you can see in the brief footage (https://i.lihkg.com/540/https://na.cx/i/aQu85Ja.gif) (credit to Apple Daily, a local newspaper), the girl was already on the ground, with her hands over her head, while the batons rained down on her. If you watch closely, you can see two of them using the shield as a weapon to launch their attack (one was aimed at her head). It was clear that the girl was already under submission and the use of batons and the beating was totally unnecessary, unacceptable and horrifying to watch.

The whereabouts of the girl is still unknown.

As a Hong Kong citizen, it is heartbreaking to have seen this beating and I can't simply get the footage out of my head. Every time I feel sick just thinking of it.

I understand your organization has great impact and can spread the message to the world. Please, the world needs to see this.

Thank you.

send 咗去鏗鏘集

To whom it may concern

I'm writing to express my deep concern over the brutal beating of a teenage girl by the Hong Kong Police recently in Admiralty.

The beating took place on 12/6 during the demonstration against the Extradition Bill proposed by the HK Government. Tens of thousands of students and citizens took to the street and voiced their concerns over the terrible consequences of the bill.

During the demonstration, an unarmed girl fell prey to a dozen police officers armed with baton. As you can see in the brief footage (https://i.lihkg.com/540/https://na.cx/i/aQu85Ja.gif) (credit to Apple Daily, a local newspaper), the girl was already on the ground, with her hands over her head, while the batons rained down on her. If you watch closely, you can see two of them using the shield as a weapon to launch their attack (one was aimed at her head). It was clear that the girl was already under submission and the use of batons and the beating was totally unnecessary, unacceptable and horrifying to watch.

The whereabouts of the girl is still unknown.

Fortunately I came across one of your programs (titled 讓聲音聽得見) aired on 16/7 and in a split second the camera crew happened to have captured the girl who was still on the ground. Could you provide more information as to what happened to her afterwards? How seriously was she injured? Was she bleeding?

Was she still breathing?

As a Hong Kong citizen, it is heartbreaking to have seen this beating and I can't simply get the footage out of my head. Every time I feel sick just thinking of it.

I understand your organization has great impact and can spread the message to the world. Please, the world needs to see this.

Thank you.

紅字為新加

警方6月12日於金鐘的驅散示威者行動，網上流傳一段青年中槍後吐血的影片，一度傳出他已離世。FactWire傳真社接觸到該名傷者親述事發經過，他當時站於鐵馬後，與警方相隔三條行車線，期間沒有衝擊，卻被警方發射催淚彈擊中臉部。記者比對事發前影片，發現警員15分鐘內，最少17次以水平角度向示威者開火。

https://www.factwire.org/investigation/%E3%80%8C%E5%90%90%E8%A1%80%E9%9D%92%E5%B9%B4%E3%80%8D%E7%8F%BE%E8%BA%AB%E9%97%A2%E6%AD%BB%E8%A8%8A-%E7%AB%99%E8%91%97%E4%B9%9F%E4%B8%AD%E6%A7%8D-%E8%AD%A6%E5%AF%9F15%E5%88%86%E9%90%98%E6%B0%B4/?fbclid=IwAR1NnsiEU4zwF8SRY9NGR1ry-UA0gORGW-HjnDMdK88TxsE3cPtypSQc6Vw

my email

Subject: A teenager was brutally beaten by the police officers in Hong Kong

Dear sir

I'm writing to express my deep concern over the brutal beating of a teenage girl by the Hong Kong Police recently in Hong Kong.

The beating took place on 12/6 during the demonstration against the Extradition Bill proposed by the HK Government. Tens of thousands of students and citizens took to the street and voiced their concerns over the terrible consequences of the bill.

During the demonstration, an unarmed girl fell prey to a dozen police officers armed with baton. As you can see in the brief footage (https://i.lihkg.com/540/https://na.cx/i/aQu85Ja.gif) (credit to Apple Daily, a local newspaper), the girl was already on the ground, with her hands over her head, while the batons rained down on her. If you watch closely, you can see two of them using the shield as a weapon to launch their attack (one was aimed at her head). It was clear that the girl was already under submission and the use of batons and the beating was totally unnecessary, unacceptable and horrifying to watch.

The whereabouts of the girl is still unknown.

As a Hong Kong citizen, it is heartbreaking to have seen this beating and I can't simply get the footage out of my head. Every time I feel sick just thinking of it.

I understand your organization has great impact and can spread the message to the world. Please, the world needs to see this.

Thank you.
